location: The same. Garden of JULIA's house.

lines.text: Enter JULlA and LUCETTA

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: But say, Lucetta, now we are alone, Wouldst thou then counsel me to fall in love?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Ay, madam, so you stumble not unheedfully.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Of all the fair resort of gentlemen That every day with parle encounter me, In thy opinion which is worthiest love?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Please you repeat their names, I'll show my mind According to my shallow simple skill.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: What think'st thou of the fair Sir Eglamour?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: As of a knight well-spoken, neat and fine; But, were I you, he never should be mine.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: What think'st thou of the rich Mercatio?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Well of his wealth; but of himself, so so.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: What think'st thou of the gentle Proteus?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Lord, Lord! to see what folly reigns in us!

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: How now! what means this passion at his name?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Pardon, dear madam: 'tis a passing shame That I, unworthy body as I am, Should censure thus on lovely gentlemen.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Why not on Proteus, as of all the rest?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Then thus: of many good I think him best.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Your reason?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: I have no other, but a woman's reason; I think him so because I think him so.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: And wouldst thou have me cast my love on him?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Ay, if you thought your love not cast away.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Why he, of all the rest, hath never moved me.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Yet he, of all the rest, I think, best loves ye.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: His little speaking shows his love but small.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Fire that's closest kept burns most of all.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: They do not love that do not show their love.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: O, they love least that let men know their love.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: I would I knew his mind.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Peruse this paper, madam.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: 'To Julia.' Say, from whom?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: That the contents will show.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Say, say, who gave it thee?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Valentine's page; and sent, I think, from Proteus. He would have given it you; but I, being in the way, Did in your name receive it: pardon the fault I pray.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Now, by my modesty, a goodly broker! Dare you presume to harbour wanton lines? To whisper and conspire against my youth? Now, trust me, 'tis an office of great worth And you an officer fit for the place. Or else return no more into my sight.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: To plead for love deserves more fee than hate.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Will ye be gone?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: That you may ruminate.
Exit

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: And yet I would I had o'erlooked the letter: It were a shame to call her back again And pray her to a fault for which I chid her. What a fool is she, that knows I am a maid, And would not force the letter to my view! Since maids, in modesty, say 'no' to that Which they would have the profferer construe 'ay.' Fie, fie, how wayward is this foolish love That, like a testy babe, will scratch the nurse And presently all humbled kiss the rod! How churlishly I chid Lucetta hence, When willingly I would have had her here! How angerly I taught my brow to frown, When inward joy enforced my heart to smile! My penance is to call Lucetta back And ask remission for my folly past. What ho! Lucetta!
Re-enter LUCETTA

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: What would your ladyship?

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Is't near dinner-time?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: I would it were, That you might kill your stomach on your meat And not upon your maid.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: What is't that you took up so gingerly?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Why didst thou stoop, then?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: To take a paper up that I let fall.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: And is that paper nothing?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Nothing concerning me.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Then let it lie for those that it concerns.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Madam, it will not lie where it concerns Unless it have a false interpeter.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Some love of yours hath writ to you in rhyme.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: That I might sing it, madam, to a tune. Give me a note: your ladyship can set.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: As little by such toys as may be possible. Best sing it to the tune of 'Light o' love.'

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: It is too heavy for so light a tune.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Heavy! belike it hath some burden then?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Ay, and melodious were it, would you sing it.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: And why not you?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: I cannot reach so high.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Let's see your song. How now, minion!

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Keep tune there still, so you will sing it out: And yet methinks I do not like this tune.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: You do not?

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: No, madam; it is too sharp.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: You, minion, are too saucy.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Nay, now you are too flat And mar the concord with too harsh a descant: There wanteth but a mean to fill your song.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: The mean is drown'd with your unruly bass.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Indeed, I bid the base for Proteus.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: This babble shall not henceforth trouble me. Here is a coil with protestation! Go get you gone, and let the papers lie: You would be fingering them, to anger me.
Tears the letter

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: She makes it strange; but she would be best pleased To be so anger'd with another letter.
Exit

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Nay, would I were so anger'd with the same! O hateful hands, to tear such loving words! Injurious wasps, to feed on such sweet honey And kill the bees that yield it with your stings! I'll kiss each several paper for amends. Look, here is writ 'kind Julia.' Unkind Julia! As in revenge of thy ingratitude, I throw thy name against the bruising stones, Trampling contemptuously on thy disdain. And here is writ 'love-wounded Proteus.' Poor wounded name! my bosom as a bed Shall lodge thee till thy wound be thoroughly heal'd; And thus I search it with a sovereign kiss. But twice or thrice was 'Proteus' written down. Be calm, good wind, blow not a word away Till I have found each letter in the letter, Except mine own name: that some whirlwind bear Unto a ragged fearful-hanging rock And throw it thence into the raging sea! Lo, here in one line is his name twice writ, 'Poor forlorn Proteus, passionate Proteus, To the sweet Julia:' that I'll tear away. And yet I will not, sith so prettily He couples it to his complaining names. Thus will I fold them one on another: Now kiss, embrace, contend, do what you will.
Re-enter LUCETTA

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Madam, Dinner is ready, and your father stays.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Well, let us go.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: What, shall these papers lie like tell-tales here?

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: If you respect them, best to take them up.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Nay, I was taken up for laying them down: Yet here they shall not lie, for catching cold.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: I see you have a month's mind to them.

lines.speaker: lucetta
lines.text: Ay, madam, you may say what sights you see; I see things too, although you judge I wink.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Come, come; will't please you go?
Exeunt
